text:
Kolor:  Czarny, całkowicie nieprzejrzysty. 
 Piana:  Drobno ziarnista, brązowa, niezbyt trwała. Po przelaniu do szkła pojawiło się może z 2-3 cm puchu, który skurczył się do wstążeczki. 
Na krawędziach kielicha można zaobserwować niewielkie zacieki. 
 Zapach:  Miazga! Jest na prawdę grubo! Aromat beczek po szlachetnych alkoholach dosłownie obezwładnia zmysły. Początkowo czuć wyraźną owocową stronę beczki po brandy. Nie sposób wymienić wszystkie występujące tutaj owoce. Z pewnością nie brakuje śliwek, jabłek i odrobiny ciemnych winogron. Kiedy umysł przyzwyczai się już trochę do tej owocowej woni, na salony wkraczają solidne podwaliny beczki po bourbonie: mokre drewno i bardzo intensywna wanilia.
Bukiet aromatów uzupełniają nuty toffi, karmelu, cukru brązowego i miodu wielokwiatowego.
Solidnie, intensywnie, po prostu cudownie! 
 Smak:  Smak ustępuje odrobinę kolosalnemu aromatowi.
W pierwszym odczuciu piwo daje mocne odczucia kawy z mlekiem.
Brak nut palonych, ale wyraźna lekko osłodzona kawa.
Wtóruje jej gorzka czekolada. Beczka po bourbonie wysuwa się naprzeciw. Daje posmaki dębiny i mokrego drewna.
Beczka po brandy natomiast stanowi tło kompozycji. 
Nuty owocowe są wyraźnie stonowane i nie są już tak jednoznaczne jak w aromacie.
Dodać należy także trochę karmelu i odrobinę toffi.
I teraz najciekawsza sprawa - silne alkoholowe nuty! Ocierające się już nawet o rozpuszczalnik.
Z każdym kolejnym łykiem czuje potężne rozgrzewania w piersi i w przełyku.
Tekstura trunku jest umiarkowana.
W tej kwestii pozostawia wiele do życzenia.
Piwo wybitnie degustacyjne. Po jednej buteleczce czułem, że już kręci mi się w głowie. 
 Wysycenie: Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Aż wierzyć mi się nie chce jak to piwo potrafiłi ewoluować w czasie.
Aromat był po prostu zniewalający.
Piwo zwalało z nóg intensywnością doznań sensorycznych.
Beczka po brandy z jej charakterystycznym owocowym profilem. Doskonale komponowała się z waniliowym i dębowych charakterem bourbonu. 
Smak początkowo spójny i wielowarstwowy wraz z ogrzaniem zaczął zaburzać intensywny alkohol.
Piwo ma ogromy potencjał, ale sugerowałbym przeczekać parę miesięcy z degustacją.
Jedna buteleczka to wydatek 90-100 zł. Koszt bardzo wysoki, więc sugerowałbym przeczekać z degustacją w celu uniknięcia niepotrzebnych rozczarowań.

Piana średnia, sycząca, szybko opada do firanki. Barwa brązowa, nieprzejrzysta. W aromacie przyjemna wanilia, toffi, karmel, czekolada, do tego jakieś suszone owoce, melasa, porto, bourbon... Klasa! W smaku mamy powtórkę, jest słodko, lepko, jest lekka paloność, szorstkość, jest tytoniowa, nieduża goryczka w kontrze, jest w końcu całkiem fajne, pełne body, drobne, delikatnie kłujące wysycenie, rozgrzewająca brandy na finiszu (prawdopodobnie za rok byłaby wręcz niewyczuwalna).

Co tu dużo mówić - absolutnie światowy top - świetnie oddana beczka, intensywne w zapachu i smaku, oleista faktura pomimo barrel agingu, nieziemsko smaczne a jednocześnie złożone...

12.7oz corked bottle, opened with just the slightest pop. Little to no carbonation, only until after the pour hits the bottom of the glass that you see some carbonation. Pitch black in color, with slight lacing on glass. Aroma is heavy bourbon, oak, maple syrup and a sweet honey smell. Taste is, again, bourbon, sweet coffee, Nutella, burnt sugar, maple sugar candy. Lingering aftertaste, ending with a smooth burn. Nice
Overhyped relic from old time beer days. Tons of bourbon and pkenty of astringent oak like chewing bark. Pours dark brown without much head. Syrupy pour. Sweet caramel and lots of booze.

Aroma: fruity brandy notes, vanilla, caramel, chocolate, prune, nuts, toast, marshmallow
Taste: heavy sweet, light bitter, vanilla, fruity brandy notes, marshmallow, caramel, toffee, nuts

Bottle thanks to BenH! Pours 95% opaque brown with a miniscule brown head which immediately retreats. Aroma is fudge and caramel with some fruitiness mixed in. Taste is caramel sweet, raisins, oak, slightly dusty, cocoa, slight brandy tartness at the end.
Aromat karmelu, drewna, melasy, wanilii, kawy, przebijają też nuty brandy. W smaku ogrom wrażeń, świetna praca beczek, wybitnie degustacyjne, ale świetne !
Flaske. Svart farge. Lavt karbonert. Neste uten skum. Preg av portvin,eik, plomme,lakris,brandy og bourbon. Helt sinnsykt god

375ml bottle from Bottleworks, Seattle. Vintage 2017. Pours an almost black with a dark beige head. Aroma sweet with apples, bourbon, and chocolate notes. Taste is sweet, chocolate, bourbon. Very good sipper.

12.7 oz bottle. Dark black color with a brown head. Sweet bourbon and red wine aroma. Dark chocolate slight tobacco alcohol bourbon flavour. Heavy body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Thanks JC. Aroma is very nice, loads of fruit, ovaltine, coconut, booze, bourbon. Taste is very good. Rich, smooth, slick, booze is hidden but comes. Beautiful sweetness. Great stuff.

Bottle aged about a 1.5 years and poured into a taster showing taster showing pitch black with no head and very thick. 

The nose shows restrained light notes of light bourbon - oak, vanilla, and smoke. 

The palate is full bodied and lightly carbonated. Light alcoholic spiciness that develops to a big alcoholic spiciness on the end. Flavors of subdued bourbon with a light vanilla mouthfeel.

Dark brown color. Lots of brown sugar, molassses, fudge, burnt raisins, cherries, brandy, oak, vanilla in the nose. Amazingly bourbon brandy, molasses, dark chocolate, cherries, stewed oranges. Amazingly lingering warm molasses and brandy finish. Awesome.

Aroma: Nu taa, kaut kas loti savadaks ka parastie BA, maiga un ziidaina koka, upenju, vaniljas dvaka :) Gar?? ari 12.5 abv loti labi noslepts, mazliet domin? brendijs, lidz ar to rozine, plume un kadikoga gar??.

Corked 0.375l bottle @ Top Hops BA Bottle Share. This is a really deep intense oily black looking one with a small quickly sidesticking brownish top. Really lovely rich and nice aroma. Almost what I will call really sweet at first then it melts with wood, vanilla, spices, alcohol and licorice. Much the same in the lovely taste + some mild sourness, or perhaps tartness is a better describing word. Lighter than I imagined on the mouthfeel. Some heartburn from the alcohol - but it really works with all these amazing flavors. Really flavorful one for sure! Wish I had more time with this one. Ill go ahead and classify this as near amazing! 15.06.2013

Dark brown, thin head. Mapley, vanillin, complex nose requires study. On the palate, sweet, bourbon, sticky rich, rounded alcohol and barrel notes. Already wishing I had more and Im not even finished. Decadent but the influence of the brandy barrel lends fruit...the roastier stout elements are almost entirely subdued. Ridiculous.
Thick black and a small tan head. Nitrogen like bubbles. Aroma of roasted coffe and oak. Flavor dark roast sme alcohol heat, thick viscous mouthfeel and roast finish.

Pours pitch black with no head. Aroma of leather, wood, vanilla, molasses and figs. Evident barrel notes of toast, vanilla and very light dill. Big, bold taste with loads of berries upfront quickly turning into leather, wood, figs, vanilla and rich toffee. Big notes of bourbon coming through as well. Sweetish with a dry, woody finish. Big bodied with a very light carbonation. This is quite a monster.
Pours a viscous thick black color with aroma of vanilla, chocolate, fig, brandy, and dark fruit. Complex flavor with dark fruits, fig, and vanilla with chocolate and brandy booziness. Awesome beer!
A: Deep dark brown/black, no head N: Bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, toffee T: Vanilla, toffee, chocolate O: A bit boozy, but quite complex. Nice

On tap at Harrys Hofbrau in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is charred dark fruits, dark chocolate, slight brandy / liqueur notes. Taste is dark chocolate with some burnt and brandied fruit bits. Excellent but had this back-to-back with the Port Older Viscosity (which was on a completely different level despite behind so closely rated ) American Strong Ale - Port Older Viscosity (#3) / Lost Abbey Deliverance (#4)

Botle. Pours a dark ruby red beer withouth any head or signs of carbonation on top. Aroma is masterfull, loads of bourbon notes, sweet oak, molasses and sweet vanilla with hints of caramel. Flavor is intense, sweetness, some boozy notes, rich oak notes. The richness and complexity of this beer is amazing. Dark red fruits, loads of bourbon, sweeter booze and all mixed to perfection. No carbonation, silky cloying mouhfeel and long, long sweet finish. Awesome!
Aroma of chocolate and bourbon. The taste is chocolate, coffee, bourbon and vanilla. Quite dry and medium sweet finish.

(Bottle) Black colour, flat with no head. Malty, roasted nose with notes of caramel, coffee, oak wood, vanilla, dried fruit, chocolate and a touch of brandy. A slight Angels Share acidity. Malty, roasted taste with black coffee, caramel, dried fruit, oak wood, vanilla, bourbon, treacle, sweet liquorice and a warming finish with hints of bourbon and a generous cacao bitterness. Full body, slightly oily mouthfeel, with a certain sweetness. Dark, complex, powerful and long-lasting like the Opeth song with the same name. Excellent beer!

It pours very dark with very little head. The aroma has brandy, dark caramel, figs, red wine, toffee and some oak. It has oily thick body with very little carbonation. The taste has brandy, red berries, dark caramel/toffee, rich malt and shows a lot more barleywine than stout. The finish is very oaky and shows some bourbon. Excellent. Big thanks to gregwilsonstl for sharing this beauty with me.
No head. Thick. Smells like bourbon. One of the strongest smelling beers I can remember.  Very strong aroma. Oak. Vanilla. Toffee. Almost too much bourbon for me. Thx Malster85.

2013 bottle. Black with a almost no head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, raisin, roasted malt. Pretty sweet taste with raisin, fudge, chocolate, vanilla and some alcohol. Sticky texture. Almost no carbonation. Long finish. Awesome beer.

(375ml bottle shared @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Apr 5 2016) Pours pitch black with a tiny whitish ring of bubbles. Aroma is driven by the bourbon barrel with vanilla and coconut, molasses, dark fruit, a touch vinous, some wood. On the palate, bourbon and brandy in more balance, again molasses core with chocolate, very light roast, dark fruits, vinous brandy notes, oaky vanilla, bourbon and fortified wine. Finish fairly sweet but dried by alcohol, persistent brandy notes, wood and soft roast. Medium bodied, touch thinner than expected, nearly zero carbonation. Pleased the bourbon wasnt as overpowering as the first smell hinted, more was buried beneath and the flavour was a much more integrated experience.
Fantastic beer. Draft at the Stone Pour it Black Event. Good stuff coming out of this. Wasnt sure what to expect.
Bottle share dark pitted fruit and roasty. Smooth and tasty laugh a little abv burn at the end
Bottle from Chris, 2004 vintage. Aroma wraps up the ABV, fruity essence, dark pit fruit, oily slick body. Quad? Delicious? Yea!

375 ml bottle. Pitch black body with a dense beige head. Nice, strong aroma of dark malt, molasses, caramel, dry fruit and warming alcohol. Flavor is sweet, dark, medium roasted malt, caramel, dry fruit, spices, moderate bitterness and warming alcohol. Full bodied and long lasting nice aftertaste. A really balanced beer with strong flavors that seems to be incredible integrated with each other. Nothing really stands out, even the alcohol is pretty well hidden, at the same thing nothing seems to be missing here. Great stuff.

Aroma caramel, roasty, alcohol, vanilla, woody, licorice, 
Appearance black, minimal head, brown foam, 
Taste medium sweetness, 
Palate medium body, thin feel, 
Overall this was a vintage 2014 bottle that has mellowed very nice. The 12.5% is there but very easy to drink. Its on the lines of a wine. Lots of wood in the taste. Its a perfect beer for sipping on a cold winters night. I would suggest this beer to a friend.

Flaska inköpt på alehouse riga 2014. Svartbrun kulör. Nästan inget skum. Krafull doft. Knäck, russin, burboun och vanilj. I smak mörk choklad, fat, knäck, torkad frukt, portvin och vanilj. Värmande alkohol och fin munkänsla. Otroligt komplex

375cl, thanks FaPhil, 20150926 Looks like black motor oil. Ashy burn aroma. Dry yet sugary and sweet. Very curious combination. Malty, strong and enjoyable to the last drop. Aroma is what sticks for a long time.

2.5 year old bottle bought at the brewery. Huge, complex with a lot going on. Pours a thick, viscous, headless jet black. Aromas are bourbon, vanilla and some chocolate. Flavors include the same as well as subtle brandy, oak, roasted malts, and dark roasted coffee. Big and boozy.

Aroma - carmalized sugars, roast, oak barrel, boozy bourbon, and some anise
Appearance - dark brown. No head to speak of.
Taste - is heavy sweet and astringent roast. Dark fruits, bourbon oakiness as well.
Palate - body is full, slick texture, soft carbonation, long boozy finish that holds astringent bitters.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

375ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Dark brown almost black color with small light beige head that quickly disappears. Malty aroma, roasted, chocolate, caramel, licorice, dark dried fruits, vanilla, wood, alcohol. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium to full oily sticky body with flat carbonation.

Bottled from Systembolaget. Bought a de years ago. 
Almost black with no head. 
Vinous aroma with salty liquorice, chocolate, cold coffee. 
Slightly oily palate. 
Salty liquorice and cold coffee in the flavour. Rather sweet.
Bottle from Deconinck, Vichte. Dark brown colour, beige foam. Sweet nose of brandy, vanilla, caramel, dried fruit. Also roasty bitter and hoppy finish. Good brew but alcoholic.
Corked 37.5 cl @ home. Pours black with no head. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, chocolate, dried fruit, bourbon, and vanilla - with a roasted and slightly alcoholic finish.

375ml bottle (thanks FatPhil). Murky very dark brown color. No head. Vineous, raisins, sweet, dark plums in aroma. Sweet, malty, alcohol, medicinal, licorice in taste. Sweet licorice in aftertaste. Not for my taste. Stale.

750ml bottle (300e of overpriced beer tasting) (Alus Celle, Riga)
Super sweet malty bourbon aroma - hot! Looks good, nice and dark, brief tight head. Sticky sweet body. No beer here, only bourbon. Well, it is drinkable as a sipper, as if it was a spirit, I guess. A sweet boozy passable thing.

Appearance- pours very, very dark, just about pitch black. No head at all, apart from a tan bubbly rim. Aroma- wow. Quite boozy, treacle, chocolate fudge, molasses, brown sugar, bourbon, vanilla ice cream, golden syrup, melted dark chocolate, rum, leather, cherry skins, brandy, sultanas, booze-soaked prunes, Christmas pudding with brandy butter. Smells outrageous. Taste- dark chocolate, roasted malt, bitter coffee, bourbon, you can taste the apple brandy, a bit like slightly burnt fruitcake with apples in it. Smoky, leathery, burnt toast notes, syrup and treacle, chocolate fudge, sweet dark fruits. Roasty, bitter and lingering finish. Mouthfeel is syrupy and slick, but not quite as full as expected. The alcohol is very well-hidden. This is excellent, slightly let down by the lack of carbonation.
Bottle. Aroma is sweet, vanilla, bourbon, brandy. Flavor is sweet, cocoa, bourbon, dark chocolate, malt, roast, alcohol. Finish is dark chocolate and alcohol. Overall: great brew.

(Bottle, 0.375 l, thanks FaPhil, 20150926) The beer poured black. Hardly any head was formed. Aroma had vineousness, booze and vanilla. Palate was medium bodied and dry with low carbonation. Flavours were sweetness, vanilla, burnt malts, wood and low bitterness. Aftertaste had excessive sweetness and low bitterness. A way too sweet and boozy brew.

Dark brown beer, almost no head. Nose is milk chocolate, bourbon, oaky notes, ash, leathery notes and boozy sweetness. Flavor is coffee, chocolate, booze, bourbon, dried fruit. Finishes with tons of booze, bourbon and dried fruit.
Svart farve med beige skum. Lukt av sjokolade, lakris, whiskey og eik. Smak av kaffe, sjokolade, lakris, whiskey, eik og bek. Vinøs. Melkebaren.

37,5cl bottle.at home. Pitch black, thick ale topped by just some foamy, brown bubbles. Incredibly rich and complex nose with big bourbon and brandy tones coming through, vanilla, honey, roasted malty coffee and milky chocolate, sweet and dried fruits like figs and raisins. Taste is rich on the mentioned aroma notes, with a sticky mouthfeel completely covering the palate for minutes; lightly bitter, lightly sour too. Great balance, big alcoholic warmth. Big body, low carbonation. Incredibly well executed.
Black color with a small head. Very boozy aroma. Heavy bourbon, hints of marshamallow sweetness. Sweet vanilla flavor, but very dry and oaky. Alcohol is pretty hot. Light roast and coffee. Full body.

From bottle. Wonderful bourbon aromas, figs, vanilla, chocolate, molasses, and pleasant soy sauce. Dark black opaque with thin tan head. Chewy body with medium carbonation. Starts rich with bourbon, chocolate, molasses, and toasted grain. Vanilla and figs. Alcohol warming. Rich and mellow bourbon finish with lingering sweet after. Powerful but not cloying. Nice ale.
The barrel qualities are somewhat muted but the malt qualities are just over the top. This beer is so rich, luxuriant & smooth. Perfectly balanced.
Bottle shared by Brian...thanks buddy. Black pour with almost no head. Aroma is mostly the brandy barrel. Taste is a little boozy but nice finish. Really good stuff.

Bottle @ ZEBF 2015. Black pour, as almost everything at ZEBF. Deliciously rich aroma of vanilla bourbon, chocolate and coffee. Taste is thick and full, with bourbon vanilla, some boozy grape, coffee, cacao and oak. Fantastic.
This one was a good surprise. Better as expected. But ofcourse the beer is a blend of 2 very nice brews.
Great blend. Wood, bourbon, and a great strong malt sirup taste. Warm alcohol finish.

Small bottle like a wine bottle split. Big caramel and sweet chocolate aroma. Taste very rich molasses and some chocolate. Mostly caramel and molasses. Flavor slightly sweet and complex. Finishes very malty with probes and some mellow coffee.

Black brew with a tiny brown ring. Slightly burn caramel, roasted hint, alcohol heat, light coffee, vanilla and bourbon. Sweet with some bitterness flash. Full body with a soft carbonation, alcohol heat, thick with a long, strong caramel finish. It is a heavy brew.
Bottle to glass. Pours a black color, not much head, almost flat. Aroma is of booze, bourbon, raisin. taste is bourbon, oak, raisin, coats the mouth a bit.

Bottle thanks to chebyshev, shared with Luk. Deep mahogany brown pour with thin straw foam. Decadent chocolate booze winey aroma, light bourbon, vanilla, figs, brown sugar, molasses and light anise notes. Taste is rich, sweet, very tasty, great intensity of flavor. Palate is full bodied and chewy with just enough carbonation to make it drinkable. Great sipper.
375ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Black colour no head. Aroma is roasted malt chocolate, and coffee deep dark fruit. Taste is medium sweet and spice. Finish is warming. Exceptional beer.

Bottle from a while back, via notes. Pours deep black with no head. Aroma is brandy, chocolate, slight coffee. Taste is very barrel forward with the vanilla, chocolate, some coffee. Raisin comes in there a little too. Nice bottle though the carb is a little bit of an issue.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Apparently a blend of a barley wine and an imperial stout aged on bourbon and brandy barrels - sounds promising. Vintage bottle of a few years of age, but the bottling date is unfortunately not mentioned anywhere. Deep brownish beige head, thin and creamy, needing some forcing to develop and breaking open in instants, but retaining well around the edges; colour is a very, very dark mahogany, almost opaque jet black. The bouquet is simply heavenly: a rich and absolutely beguiling perfume of warm chocolate sauce with cognac, cocoa, espresso, whisky, lovely vanilla tannins, candied dates and raisins, orange liqueur accent, liquorice, gingerbread, black pepper, old tawny port, pipe tobacco, dusty cellar but in a noble kind of way fitting in wonderfully, banana, cloves, aniseed... Unbelievably rich and stunning taste as well, starting with a deep bonbon- and subtly banana-like candied sweetness with sourish accents (candied lemon, but very subtle) as well as a finely tingling effect of both alcohol and carbonation, candi sugar sweetness but right in place (i.e. not cloying), plunging into an abysmal world of malts, very chocolatey, caramelly, nutty, with a very oily, fat, thickly vinous and filling body, evolving into a big finish of roasted malt bitterishness, yet gently so and not overly coffeeish, bitter chocolate, lots of oaky woodiness and tannins, peppery hops and of course a big deal of cognac-like alcohol, warming the throat and chest and stinging a little bit, yet still not becoming too obnoxious. I can see how this holds the middle between an impy and a barley wine. This is the beer equivalent of the finest liquor, be it cognac or single malt; absolutely perfect for a rainy Sunday afternoon. Simply divine.

375ml bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours deep dark brown with an almost invisible light brown head. Aroma is light roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, wood, molasses, figs, raisins, bourbon and vanilla. Flavour is medium sweet with some heat. Full bodied, motor oil texture, carbonation is soft. Finish is complex and warming with a small alcohol kick.

Bottle. Pours black with zero head. Molasses aroma over mild carbonation. Rich and chewy mouthfeel. Boozy in all the right ways. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Strong dark chocolate and charred wood aroma. Nearly opaque black with almost no head. More dark chocolate in the taste with dark cherries, licorice, molasses and black jelly beans. Noticeable alcohol bite, but not nearly what I would expect at 12.5% ABV. Leaves a dry, sweet, chocolate and charred taste behind. Unlike other beers in this league (Im looking at you, The Beast), this is incredibly drinkable for how heavy and massive this beer is.
Testad på Linköping Beer Expo. Härliga dofter av torkade frukter men också lite ek och bourbon. Känns mycket len i munnen och smaker av vanilj och choklad. Mycket god öl!

Underbar doft av dadlar, fikon, russin, bourbon och konjak som samsas med svagt rostade ek- och vaniljtoner. Smaken är en balanserad sammansättning av ovanstående smaker och som bärs upp av en värmande alkoholhalt. Mycket, mycket god.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2015 Sweet, woody nose with caramelized sugar, oak, vanilla, a bit of brandy, dark fruits, and powdered cocoa in the background. The mouthfeel is stiff, with a medium-to-viscous body, peppery alcohol, and low carbonation. Hot, hot in the mouth. The taste is woody, malty sweet with moderate but sustained bitterness and a subtle, fruity finish The alcohol is dominant here, though: on the back of the palate, it feels like blowing cool air on skin with rubbing alcohol on it. I think it needs to be mellowed down by age for full enjoyment.

Pours deep dark brown where no light shall pass. No head and no lace. It looks like an after dinner beverage. 

Very see et, like a cross between a port and a Framboise (with no sourness).

Strong alcohol and cloyingly sweet dark cocoa flavor. Definitely a "beer" to drink by the fire. Think brandy snifter with a carbonated, raspberry tinged after dinner liqueur. Rich, rich body but with a decent level of carbonation. Long raisiny aftertaste.
Batch 1. Smells like malt. Taste is malt, booze, and bourbon. Almost no carbonation.
Black pour, nice brown head. Aroma is amazing, bourbon, oak, chocolate and vanilla. Flavor is chocolate, cherries, booze, and fruit. Smooth full body.

Ancient rating from Hunahpus Day 2012, I recently found my tasting notes. Figured why waste good ticksremember how complex this tasted. Caramel, grapes, brandy and bourbon both distinct, vanilla, woody. Intense and great.

I?ve wanted to try this baby for a long time. I?m pumped to finally crack it open. Pours an inky black with zero head. Aromas of sweet bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, and a bit of coconut. Nice cocoa nib flavors, sweet booze, coconut, vinous brandy, vanilla. No carbonation. I love this beer, I love this brewery. Cheers!
-short review- overall: the aftertaste develops in stages. The overall beer is thick and compact. Truly a sipper

Nez puissant sur le chocolat, les arômes grillés et boisés, accompagnés de raisins secs. Quelques arômes de vanille. Bouche ample sur le chocolat et les notes vanillées. On retrouve le brandy et le bourbon. Belles notes torréfiées et grillées. Finale torréfiée, longue, douce et amère sur le chocolat et les fruits secs.

2012 vintage bottle. Pours black with copper hues. Still, like half-spent motor oil. Oily texture provides some legs. Aromas are of light roast, light raisin sweetness and lots of barrel character in the form of wet oak, bourbon and a brandy sweetness. Taste is much thinner than expected. Not a whole lot of depth here. I get lots of bourbon/brandy interplay, but the roast, barley, anise and oak are extremely faint and in the background. Finishes pretty hot with a warm bourbon/molasses/brandy interplay. Not what I was expecting.

Bottle 12.7 fl. oz. at Beer Junction, Seattle. Vintage 2014. Colour is dark brown with very small brownish head. Aromas and flavours: Wood, some coffee, chocolate, hints of bourbon and roasted malts. Very soft. Cant find any signs of alcohol or booze. Very special.

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks DSG. Black and opaque.Petrol, ink and salt aroma, bitter, a little salty but also lots of chocolate in the mouth. Full body, chocolatey and salt aftertaste.

Butelka 375ml.
OCZY : piwo jest czarne o niewielkiej pianie. Piana jest brązowa. 

NOS : aromat jest średnio intensywny ze względu na śladowe nasycenie ale jest wyraźny : dominujące nuty to czekolada, bakalie, wanilia i alkohol podkreślony nutami bourbona i brandy od beczek z odzysku. Całość jest baaardzo przyjemna i ułożona. Łączy to wszystko głębia lekko dymionego i starego drewna plus ciemnego miodu. 

USTA : nasycenie jest bardzo delikatne o drobniutkich bąbelkach. Tłuste i gęste jak śmietana. 
Piwo jest słodkie ale nie lepkie. Występuje pewna wytrawność alkoholowa o nutach w stylu bourbona do której można dodać zwietrzałe rodzynki. Gorzkość jest również delikatna o nutach podobnych do czarnej czekolady. Posmak jest głęboki ale aksamitny bo nic nie zalega, ani nie jest cierpkie ani ziemiste. 

ODCZUCIA : jest to prawdziwy rarytas, trunek, na który warto wydać pieniądze. Więcej w nim polotu niż w niejednym szlachetnym alkoholu. Polecam gorąco dla amatorów piw leżakowanych w beczkach z odzysku.

Draft. This was pretty excellent. Cherries, brandy, wood, malt, roast, vanilla, fig, it just goes on and on. No need for dessert, just savor this after a meal.

Rich nose! Cherry, dried dates, oak, wet wood, caramel, vanilla: phew! Very viscous and boozey taste, filled with forest fruit in aftertaste, milk chocolate hints, alcohol of brandy and whiskey. Phenols and esters are strong, especialy the ethyl hexanoate : lovely anis binded to the sugar spectrum! Lots of potential... yes, very sugarry aftertaste and the booze overstems the combination of flavours. Still amazing when aged!

Complex and intense form start to finish. Lots of fruit and woody oaky notes in the aroma. Flavor has a lot of red fruit again and that brandy sweetness. Little bit of a gritty cocoa texture going on. Reminds you that the stout is there. Everything comes together pretty well but the barley wine and apple barrel kind of dominate. Had a similar blended beer a day or two ago and this one kills it.

Mélybarna, imperial stout-szerű ital gurul ki a nagyszabású üvegből, gyűszűnyi, de mégis sokatmondó, marcona italokon rendre felbukkanó típusú habkéreggel. Nagy formátumú, strukturált, magas százalékú alkoholok detonációja érkezik meg aztán lehengerlő erővel, az illatmolekulák egyszerűen belefúródnak a receptorainkba. Tüzes bourbon-aromái konyakkal átitatott faháncs, forró étcsokoládé, karamellás-kakaós-kókuszos-vaníliás belga édességek hangulatát egyszerre idézik meg; sötét és rabul ejtő a kezdés. Mint az várható volt, a kortyok önálló életre kelnek, és bár az alkohol masszív jelenléte a whiskys, brandys jegyekkel felülírhatatlan, sokszínű és megfejthetetlenül összetett jellege mentén lenyűgöző karakterek sokasága tárul elénk. Bár a jellemvonásai közeli rokonságot mutatnak egy vérmesebb imperial stouttal, kevésbé testes és mérsékeltebb módon szirupos jellege megdöbbentőbb vadsággal párosul. Mindez a kolosszális szerkezet egy bársonyosan szétterülő kakaós lepelbe van burkolva, mely simulékony étcsokoládés jegyekkel csalogat, a masszív alkoholos test vaníliás bourbon fergetege azonban megmutatja igazi erejét. Szeszben ázott fahordó füstös malátás zamatainak élét sós karamella lágysága puhítja, majd keserű likőrök zord lecsengése karcolja össze a képet. Kaliberénél fogva fontos alkalmak méltó kísérője lehet.

Bottle shared at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Black with a brown head. Aroma of cocoa, dark chocolate, cookies, vanilla and a dark fruit note. Sweet flavor with chocolate, cookies, dark fruits, vanilla, wood, bourbon and a slightly alcoholic warming finish. Full-bodied. Really good.

375ml corked bottle, 2014 vintage. Another great beer from lost abbey! Great aroma of bourbon, oak, vanilla, dark fruit and a little bit booze. Pours black with virtually no head but what's there is light brown with no lacing. Starts with dark fruit and bourbon flavors with hints of vanilla. Finishes extremely smooth with oak flavors joining the party with some booze lingering on the palate. Great beer, rich and flavorful.
One of the most amazing beers Ive had. This brew has it all: maltiness, fruit, oak, and even a touch of citrussy bitterness from the hops. Leaves a nice but not overwhelming finish. Outstanding!

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2015 2014 bottle poured into a snifter..jet black with a thin khaki head..aroma of booze,coffee,caramel,dark fruits,molasses..taste of vanilla,caramel,oak,toffee and as it warmed coffee,chocolate,cherry notes come through..good stuff.

2013 vintage. Wonderful brew. Nice barrel character accompanied with dark fruits, plum, raisin, prunes, figs, dates, and toffee and dark brown sugar. Well crafted brew. Wish I had more than 1.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured into a wine glass on 05.19.14.

A: Midnight black with no red in the glass. No head, only a tan ring at the top, typical of Lost Abbey.

S: Strong vanilla, brandy, bourbon, wood barrel. Amazingly complex!

T: Vanilla, dark cherry, plum dominate. Oak barrel, milk chocolate, raisin are subtle.

M: SIlky smooth. Its like velvet. Somewhat chewy.

O: This is a beer for a special event. To say that it is complex does not do it justice. I got a wash after wash of flavor. It was very difficult to pick apart. I didnt think that the blend of Serpents Stout and Angels Share would work, but oh man it does.

Bottle from Erzbierschof - Black color with a fast disappearing brown head, small lacing - Aroma is powerfull, vanilla, bourbon, oak, chocolate, cherry, coffee, roasted malt and alcohol really entertaining - Flavor is cherry chocolate, vanilla, oaky, dried fruits, alcohol, amazing - Full body, medium bitterness ( problably more, well hidden by the alcohol), flat carbonation, sweet and silky, long cherry chocolate finish - so good, the blend is well balanced, exciting beer really complex

Sample at semi-S&G tasting (since the music was shut down halfway through).
APPEARANCE: pitch black beer, no head.
NOSE: chocolate, coffee.
TASTE: chocolate, coffee, sweet, alcohol.
Dark-red small head. Aroma of raisins and alcohol. Malt, burned caramel alcohol, raisins and vanilla in the taste. A complex one.

Bottle from Smokes n Suds. A reassuring pop of the cork before pouring a very dark brown, thin brown cap. The nose is rich, bourbon and chocolate malt. Lightly sweet, but also oak and char. The taste is also rich, a little more emphasis on the bourbon and chocolate malt. Less smoke/char and a bit of bittersweet. Rounded edges. On the downside its a bit thin... Finishes with a very soothing bourbon and chocolate note.

375ml bottle. Black and pretty headless. Just a thin coating of brown foam. Bourbon hits the nose first. Lots of dark fruits in there. Vanilla too. Something like buttery, maple-drenched pancakes as well (guessing the brandy). Taste is pretty sweet (to be expected) and a step down from the aroma but still has a nice dark fruit complexity and some heat on the backend. This is worth its high rating.

1000th review!!!!!. 12.7 oz bottle poured into my Lost Abbey long stem snifter. Pour jet black with a half finger khaki head which fade to nice lacing on the edge and nice legs as you drink it. Aroma is of dark fruits, brandy, molasses, roasted malts, espresso, bourbon, sweet malts, burnt malts, woody notes, coffee, and some light booze has it warms. Taste is brandied soaked dark fruits, brandy, roasted malts, woody bourbon, licorice, molasses, burnt sweet malts, espresso, dark chocolate, anise, and some very light booze has it warms. Has a medium-full body with a creamy, oily mouthfeel, and a mostly sweet, lingering, slightly warming, mouth coasting, long, lingering finish. Overall, a true amazing, world class beer that is defiantly worthy of being my 1000th review.

Bottle, shared with Sean. Brown pour, no head. Nose is big whiskey notes, bourbon, oak, coffee, milk chocolate and touches of booze. Flavour is intense woody, bourbon sapped chocolate and coffee with a huge bang of booze to set things off. Surprisingly medium in body, little carbonation. Oh so complex in the finish. Amazing stuff.

Bottle from a US trade. Pours black with a small tanned head. Aroma of dark malts, molasse, brandy and liquoric, inviting. Smooth, thick oily and creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonated. Taste is complex dark rich malty, well integrated light burning alcohol, traces of tar and liquorice, a beer to enjoy for a long time as Im doing right now in front of the fireplace.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2016 375cl bottle served in a snifter. Pours dark brown in the pour but once in the glass is pitch black with a hint of garnet around the edge when held up to light. Aroma is massively powerful concoction of bourbon, buttery vanilla, barrel, dark fruits and massive burnt malt. Taste is toasted fruit cake drenched in bourbon and brandy then covered in 65% coca chocolate. Sweetness is quite upfront however the rest of the beer is so powerful it balances itself out as to not be sickly. Moderate bitterness and the creamiest mouthfeel ever with no carbonation to speak of.
12.7oz bottle from Erzbierschof. Pours pitch black with no head. Its strong, intense and complex, but lacks the balance that I need to enjoy a beer that powerful.

May 4th, 2013 - Were at the halfway point here in what is easily the most luxurious, intense and flavor dense beer party Ive ever been to. Lost Abbey has taken out all the stops, and as I move from beer to beer I make an effort to go darker and darker. This strategy leads me to the Lost Abbey Deliverance, a deep, dark brew with a cratered head of muddy brown foam. Alcohol, licorice and molasses blend with all-spice, cardamon and soy in the nose, and the boozy nature of this beast appears in the flavor too. There I catch some bourbon flavor on a flat palate, leaving the alcohol not too sharp or cutting. Theres a low, oozing sugar too, with licorice, and a mostly sweet touch of brown sugar, vanilla, soy sauce and all spice. Even with a flatter mouthfeel this is an intense beer - in your face and somewhat extreme, and not at all elegant.

Ölföreningen 2014. Smak och doft av torkad frukt, karamell, marsipan, fikon med toner av läder och russin. Koncenterade dofter, tjock, rund och len. Känsla av rom, bourbon och madeira. Välbalanserad med lagom sötma. Fantastiskt gott!

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2014 Live draft at SB which means Special Brews.  Out of the 3 BA big beers in front of me this is the best, which apparently doesnt say much.  Still too much alcohol and barrel, overly big beer.  Autolysis underneath that as well, boo. However, this is in the standard over-the-top, big beer category and I know some people like that.  At least not bitter hops and alcohol is just bad as opposed to insane rubbing alcohol (i.e., another beer in front of me).  Its seems like this beer needs more Serpent Stout and less Angels Share.  Its like no matter what you do to Angels Share it still fucks up the beer.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

text: Smell of bourbon vanilla and chocolate. Similar taste. Very sweet with syrup, roasted notes and dark chocolate. Very nice, lots of flavour but not too much. The sweetness balance out the roasted.

2013 bottle- Pours dark and thick with pretty much no head. Aroma of prunes, cocoa, vanilla, and barrel. Tastes very sweet with very little bitterness and just enough booze on the finish to remind you that this is bartel aged- also leaves a bit of tannin on the finish. Flavors of prunes, orange, chery, oak, and bourbon. Very nice sipper!

How: Bottle.
Where: Tasting at omhper.
Appearance: Black colour with no head.
Aroma: Chocolate, raisin, dried fruit, sweet malt.
Body: Full body, low to medium carbonation.
Flavour: Soy sauce, chocolate, alcohol.
A lot of chocolate in smell and taste. Some hints of sweet bitterness between the chocolate.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2014 Pitch black appearance with hardly any head. The brandy from the cask is present. Boozy. Sweet, chocolate, dried fruits. Aroma can best be described by schnaps praliné. Taste is sweet, boozy, alcohol hot. A good one, but not over the top imho. And very expensive over here in Europe. Edit: more vanilla after a while, less hot. A bit better.

Black color with just a bit of mocha foam on top. Looks like an Imperial Stout. Very complex aroma of caramel, dark malts and some dried fruits. A bit of alcohol on the nose too. Taste is absolutely fantastic. Rich caramel and roasty malts, not too sweet and the barrel aging adds some wonderful complexity. Mouthfeel is also great, smooth and creamy. Really great brew.

11 bottle in late 14. Slightly murky dark brown black. Nose of dried dark fruits, light vanilla, some chocolate, and sweet booze. Fairly rich flavors, but flat lacking carbonation...a common complaint for me for BA Lost Abbey stuff. Flavors or sweet dried fig, chocolate, sweeter dark malts, light booze.

2013. Draft at Barrel Republic. Pours deep rich brown with a fizzy, bubbly tan head. Smells like strong astringent alcohol, raisin, earthy, woody, very light ash and tobacco. Tastes like alcohol, raisin, chocolate syrup, and ash. Light/medium body and very low carbonation.

Big notes of chocolate, prunes, bourbon, oak. Pitch black pour. Thick sticky lacing. Heavy stick mouthfeel. Raisins, oaky, sweet brandy, caramel, vanilla. Very intriguing, very delicious

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Definite sipper. Minimal bourbon and a nice chocolate/cocoa dryness at the end of the finish. Heavy but not overwhelming and definitely not overly sweet nor syrupy. Somewhat creamy in the middle. Great beer and Im quite curious to see how it tastes a few years from now.

On tap at Pizza Port Ocean Beach. Pours jet black with. Thin tan head. Aroma is dark fruits and roasted barley. Really amazing slightly tart. Holy cow. Amazing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from a bottle it is a dark brown color with a slight head it has an aroma of bourbon and it has the taste of licorice and it is a thick syrupy texture

375 ml bottle. 2011 vintage. Pours almost black with no head. Initial sour vinous aroma with notes of chocolate and oak. Flavors of rich oily chocolate, light bourbon, heavily roasted malts and vanilla. Hot.
Bottled, from Systembolaget.  Black, no head. Distinct bourbon/vanilla aroma. Sweet with full body and rounded mouthfeel. Bourbon, chocolate, woodm caramel and pears. Warming finish.

darl dark brown, no head. Plenty of raisins, brandy, molasses, cocoa in the aroma. Velvety mouthfeel, low carbonation. Excellent balance between sweetness and all the components, brandy like finish. Good stuff
Bottle @ Voldby. Almost pitch black pour with some tan lacings. Heavy bourbon, vanilla, boozy, some chocolate, toasty. Slow sipper.

Shared bottle with a friend. Poured a dark Brown to Black colour with a dark tanned head. A lot of Bourbon forward. A hint of red Sharp fruit, oak, vanilla, roasted malts,cred fruit, chocolate, caramel, port, molasses, very smooth and awesome Bourbon taste! Boy what an amazing sipper beer!! I loved this one so much!!

Pitch black and almost no head. Not very much to look at, but then you start tasting and smelling. Whoa! It just keeps on going. Moderate malts with coffee, roasted malts, milk chocolate, nuts, cookie, light hops with citrus fruits and there's also some yeast, vanilla, a clear taste of oak, licorice, bourbon and brandy, caramel, brown sugar, grape, raisin and prune, a hint of smoke and peat, cola, spices, tawny port. The list seems endless. Flavor is complex and subtle and switches from light acodic to light acidic and light bitter, followed by light acidic, light bitter and sweet, then sweet and bitter and warming alcohol and only sweet and warming alcohol and finishing in bitter and alcohol.
Body is full with syrupy texture and quite low carbonation.
What a beer! Incredible. Together with Westvleteren my number one so far.

Bottle to glass. Pours a pitch black color with a creamy brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, vanilla, molasses. Flavor is strong roasted malts, vanilla, bourbon, chocolate. Lingering bourbon and vanilla with a creamy mouthfeel. Extremely tasty!

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours black with an oily slick and no head. Big aroma of rum and raisins, molasses and dark fruits. Very sweet. Taste has lots of cherries, fig and bubblegum. Low carb makes this really syrupy. Bit too sweet for me but still enjoyable.

Definitely huge brew, but kinda dint worked out for me.. Moderate roasted malts, licorice, dried fruits, bourbon, choco, wood, vanilla. Its quite complex, but in same time too monolith, even boring. Mostly sweet with moderate bitterness. Nice sipping beer, but I prefer each of two brews in this one separate.
Bottle from Janes Beer Store, Mountain View. Boozy marshmallow dark fruit aroma. Similar taste. Very nice.

Bottle: Thanks, Kevin. Looks like Coca-Cola with no head. A couple small bubbles, maybe. Sticky toffee & caramel candy aroma with light fudge, molasses, raisins, figs, mild anise, & brown sugar in the aroma. Boozy, lots of brandy & alcohol that stings the nostrils. Very, very sweet, too. Taste is the same way. Boozy. Sweet. Huge amount of residual sugars. Dat brewing efficiency. Fusel heat, molasses, faint char & roast, cocoa dust black licorice, burnt caramel. Seems Serpents Stout is more relevant on the palate. A bit of raisin, brandy, brown sugar, toffee, anise, & char in the finish. Lingering heat from the booziness, leaves a sticky coating on your teeth. Not bad but really too boozy & sweet to enjoy in any decent quantity.
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is dark fruit, light smoke, toffee, vanilla, taste is sweet, chewy, toffee, bourbon, fruity.
Beer Bloggers Conference - San Diego - Super American strong ale. Nice barrel aging qualities this was very tasty

Wine glas, bought a bottle at slijterij paauwenburg, Vlissingen, The Netherlands. 
Great taste of strong coffee and sweet Caramel. Very complex with a nice hoppy flavour at the end!

Sipped from a tulip glass. Pours thick and looks just like coffee. The nose is rich with roastiness, malt, mushrooms and mahogany notes. The layers of flavors are numerous with espresso, oak, cocoa, dates and rich brown booze. Wow this beer is beyond the limits

375ml bottle from Andersonville Wine & Spirits, cellar aged 4 months and shared with ck1. Pours is almost black, with light ruby highlights. WOW!, aroma has chocolate and cherries and vanilla. The bourbon is a bit understated in the taste; just smooth chocolate, caramel and molasses, with touches of fruit. Very, very nice! 17.1

Dont know why I havent had this sooner. Pours black with only a wisp of bubbles around the edge. Delicious bourbon nose, toffee, dark fruits, and oak. Body is thick and surprisingly smooth. Stout flavors meld well with the barrel aging. Very very nice.
Väldigt kraftig och komplex arom. Mörk frukt, kanske lite russin. Väldigt fyllig kropp.

Poured from bottle to glass. Opaque hue with fizzy brown hue that held a ring. Aroma is coffee, cola, vanilla, toffee, plums, caramel, raisins, ethanol. Mouthfeel is great with a full body and soft carbonation. Taste is sweet initially with a nice astringent bitterness in the following and an ethanol finish. Overall this is a really nice brew.

Bottle vintage 2014. Pours almost pitch black with a reddish edge, and an oily, brownish head. Aroma has huge bourbon, gun powder, licorice, caramel, port wine, chocolate, syrup, dried fruits and much more. Taste is pretty boozy and bourbon up front. Nice roast, nice caramel, lots of dark, dried fruits. ends off with sweet licorice and rhum-like sweetness. Fat, full body, and a fairly low carbonation. This is a treat!
(Backlog). Bottle. Dark pour with no head. Barrel, bourbon and brandy, some darker malt tone aromas. Flavors include the barrels, some dark malts and a good bit of alcohol.

Negro opaco con espuma beige escasa. aromas de maíz, bourbon, manzana dulce, licor, chocolate y tostados. Cuerpo denso con inicio dulce y licoroso con final de amargor moderado, seco de madera y duradero. Excelente.
Bottle from Binnys. Poured black and keeps a tan ring. Aroma of sweet vanilla charred wood smoke. Light carb med thick bod. Light soapy burnt taste with vanilla bourbon. Not getting any brandy.

This is a huge beer. Pours very dark brown, opaque, with not head and minimal lacing. Nose is brown sugar, brandy and bourbon. Flavours of vanilla, espresso maybe some licorice, leather, bourbon and brandy. Taste is heavy/medium sweet, and medium/high bitterness. Fully sticky and oily body with an acidic bit to the finish that makes it feel quite dry.
Pours a very dark brown. Aroma of bourbon and brandy. Some vanilla, dark fruits. Taste is the same with some hints of coffee and some hop bitterness but not really. Medium full body. Delicious.
Poured pitch black with no head or carbonation. Smells of coffee, vanilla, cinnamon and alcohol. Tasted the same, a bit of raisins, creamy but harsh finish.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2014 Pours opaque black with brown-yellowish small top, thick and intense although. Aroma starts pleasant, rich, complicated - wood, roasted malts, light chocolate, a bit sour berries, dark-roasted caramel, and too boozy as well, reminds a bit whiskey malt. Later aroma becomes too alcoholic and monolith dark caramel. Taste was sweet, light to average bitter, more from darker malts with bourbon flavor in aftertaste, not long finish, although some astringency in mouthfeel and warming is present. To me here is no beer, more strong alcohol flavors. Oily, slick texture. Weird. but compared even with "Harviestoun Ola Dubh" which was pure strong alcohol flavorfull but still beer, I expected more rich flavor from this brew (barrel aged) but there isnt. So price/performance is "no more".

Bottled. Blending the Angels share and Serpents Stout isnt exactly a match made in heaven to my tastes, especially as I am not a fan of the latter.

2014 vintage. Pours black. A thin fizzy brown head rings the glass. Aroma beyond description. Complex is an understatement. Its a treat to just sit and smell it - the barrel character is intoxicating. Is rate the aroma 11. Full body. Chocolatey bourbon finish. Enough carbonation to keep it moving. Very sweet aroma-some bourbon, roasty, like a sweet chocolate fruit. 
Taste is similar, a little alcohol ting, chocolate, sweet, roast

I am a wine guy. Had to switch from a Zalto Burgundy glass to a much more open Nachtmann Xxl because I disliked the nose so much. Best described as sweet yeast. Kind of a fructose nose. The palate on the other hand has perfect feel, velvety and mouth coating. 2011 vintage draught at Deep Ellum, Summer of 2011Very deep, dark amber-brown body shows high clarity and a large off-white head that shows moderate retention.Very bright, vinous, nearly liquorous-like fruitiness in the nose is complimented by plentiful sweet, candied cherries, chocolate and a drying, tannic, oak and alcohol character. Very strong aroma, but even as the glass wore on, it never got uncontrollably boozey. Lots of malt layers, with caramel, pale malts and even a touch of very light roast. Wherever the fruitiness is coming from, it really makes the nose, brightening all of the deep, dark stout flavors and heavy barrel tannins/woodiness.Strong notes of amber maltiness and light chocolate are easily disrupted by a softer oak woodiness and candied raspberry sweetness. Vanilla, oranges, cherries, raisins, and so on. Very complex beer and significantly more dry than the original batches of Angels Share, IMO. The alcohol actually seems to work proactively here to dry out all of the chocolate and roast and this forward fruitiness keeps it very drinkable. Delicious, top notch!2013 vintage on draught at Publick House on 3/20/14Much, much darker and thicker than the 2011 vintage in all aspects. Color, viscosity, flavor. Again, though, I wasnt blown away by the alcohol or heat. Yes, of course it was a powerful beer and probably too thick moreso than too boozey, if anything. Chocolate and vanilla, candied prunes and chocolate covered cherries. Quite a bit going on here for sure and certainly very supple and thick/chewy. I like it, but it seems more given to a vintage BA stout than it does the more moderate strong ale sensibilities of Angels Share (not that Serpents Stout is bad, by any means). Guess I just like the older vintage better. Rating is an average.

Bottle sample at RBAG 2013. Dark brown with dark orange highlights in the glass. Head is brown and thin. Rich nose, raisins and dark fruits, sweet dark alcohol notes - bourbon? brandy? not sure. Taste has dark sugars, caramel, bourbon, sweet alcohol. Finishes with some lingering alcohol. A good rich alcoholic dark ale.

This one gets right up to the line of being boozy, after which it would fall into the depths of drain poured ness, but expertly never does. Strong bourbon aroma, and the first sips are hot, reflecting the 12.5% ABV. But the experience is worth it! There's a cacophony of bourbon, brandy, and woody flavors going on here, again getting just this close to devolving into utter undrinkable chaos, but never does. Perhaps the solid stout base helps -- and it is magnificent. A beer not for the feint of heart. The barrel-aged equivalent of a hophead's IPA. Quite good. A-

Bottle - Heavy bourbon and chocolate. Jet brown with a thin brown head and some particles. Heavy bourbon and roasted malts. Nice and a balanced bitterness to the sweetness. Very nice.

Bottle: Poured a dark cloudy brown color ale with a large foamy head with good carbonation and some lacing. Aroma consists of bourbon with residual sugar notes and caramelized sugars. Taste is also dominated by bourbon notes with some caramelized malt and quite a lot of residual sugars. Some dried fruits and light chocolate notes are also perceptible. Body is full with great carbonation and surprisingly no apparent alcohol. Nice nightcap style beer.

Bottle split by Dan Da Man at CBC, 08/07/13, cheers fella. This downstairs split makes up slightly for missing out on a sour upstairs!!!
Pours light black with no head.
Nose is dark malts, chocolate, woody notes, dark fruits.
Taste comprises dark malt, dark toffee fudge, leather, bourbon notes, oaky, mineral bite, demerara sugars.
Full bodied, moderate carbonation, warming alcohol in the finish.
Decent.

text: 2013 bottle, 13C. Hilariously cheesy label. Very dark brown, head is less than a full rim but there are a few lingering spots. Looks like theres a lighter brown layer on the top of the beer. Aroma of brandy, dark fudge, mace; vanilla and whiskey seep through after a while along with some cherries and prunes. Oily with low carbonation - maybe a tad too low. Taste is at first very sweet and butterscotchy, then some burnt dark sugars, dried fruit and port, then sweetness gives way to lightening bitterness. Curiously, the overt spirit notes depart until right at the end, where theres a booziness thats mostly whiskey (with some vanilla, pepper and wood). The alcohol note doesnt seem at all out of place. Was half expecting this to be complex without a theme, but it seems like a purposeful and judicious blend. Great with a foible or two.

2011 Bottle drank 2013 July. 

Pours with a good pop and little fleeting head & lace but good legs on a nearly opaque black brown beer. The aroma is intense and powerful with heavy brandy boozy sweetness and strong stout notes of chocolate, and even a bit of bright fruitiness. The flavor is similar more sweet than bittern but balanced by the wood and booze intensity. There some oxidation and dried dark fruits. Its silken but heavy in the mouth with lots of residual sugars only partially cleared by the alcohol and tannins. This is a monster but so good. Of the 2010 Angels Share Bourbon and 2010 brandy (infected?) and Serpent Stout this is a clear winner though the bottle seems to be in much better shape than the two Angel Share.

Poured from a 375 ml bottle into a tulip.

Opening this bottle I had to practically use a set of pliers to get the cork out. It is easy to tell even before I opened it that there would be no carbonation in this bottle. When I finally got it open and poured it aggressively, my fears were confirmed. The beer has an onyx black color with just a few stray bubbles that happened to form from the beer sloshing around in the glass.

Rich chocolate cake, bourbon, and brandy are all strong in the nose. Vanilla, roasted malt, and a bit of alcohol come through as well.

The flavors are unfortunately flattened out by the lack of carbonation. Each sip starts with dark and sweet chocolate, sweet bourbon, and brandy, with vanilla and roasted malt adding some depth in the middle. The end has a little jolt of alcohol, and the rest of the flavors really fall off into a watery finish. Again, the lack of carbonation leads to problems.

The mouthfeel is disappointing, mostly because it is totally flat. The beer has the thickness and complexity to warrant a nice, thick, viscious, and creamy mouthfeel, and it comes up way short. Instead, it feels thick and syrupy.

I imagine this could be an incredible beer if it actually had carbonation in it. Lesson learned - do not spend money on flat Lost Abbey bottles.

Bottle. Had this a day after the 2010 Angel's Share, and this blew that one out of the water. The mouthfeel and flavor were absolutely incredible. A little boozy on the nose, but the booziness in the flavor worked so well. I wish Lost Abbey wasn't so expensive out here in PA because I'd love a lot more of this.

Bottle. Pours black with a finger thick mocha head. Aroma is nicely sweet and bourbon laden, with notes of oak and red wine, as well as coffee, liquorice and some rubbery alcoholic whiffs. Full oily body with soft to flat carbonation. Flavour is sweet with lots of liquorice and nicely rounded bourbon and red wine notes, as well as some grainy oakiness giving a nice long sweet finish.
Bottle, corked and caged. Pours black with absolutely no head. Aromas are oaky, sweet with licorice. The high alcohol content is hidden in the sweet flavors of this brew.

Bottle poured into tulip glass, wow! Fantastic beer! The nose is glorious! Caramel, brown sugar, vanilla, dough...great! Mouthfeel is perfect, not too oily, not too thick, not too thin...just right! Taste is rich, smooth, a slight alcohol burn, certainly a sipper. Fantastic beer!
Thick and oily! Great taste. Has a nice bourbon after taste. Pours nice a dark. From a bottle

Black in color with a small tan head. Aroma is of wood, bourbon, bing cherries, prunes, vanilla, and leather. Taste is of roasted malts, booze, vanilla, heavy oak, bourbon, tons of prune and raisin. Flavor melds into a pleasant sweet cherry pie finish. Thick mouthfeel.

Bottle. The look is dark, brown to black in color, thin tan head. The smell is heavy, wood, cherries, plums, alcohol, toffee, oak, malt, and brown sugar. The taste is big and boozy, alcohol, wood, toffee, some dark dried fruits, and nice. Thick and oily.

Bottle. Pours dark brown, minimal tan head. Smells like bourbon, chocolate. Tastes very rich, nice light bourbon flavor, slightly fruity- like cherries. Extremely good, very flavorful! Really awesome!!!

Bottle from Jason + Elizabeth, bottle share May 2013. Pours opaque, very dark/brown. Nose is bourbon forward, with raisins, spice and maybe cookie dough as well. Rich, sweet and boozy. Maybe cinnamon and cloves? Body is rich and strong, too, finishes sweet and boozy with more dried fruit, lots of complexity. A real winner, can definitely see why the ratings are what they are.

Wow. 5/17/13. Pours DARK brown with thin brown head. Aroma is chocolate, smoke, wood, bourbon, brandy, spicy, alcohol. Taste is burn, alcohol, chocolate, booze, molasses, licorice, bread. Low carbonation. Nice, thick mouth feel. Legs! And some nice lacing. Just incredible.

What a beer!  Pours black with thin off white head.  Aromas of booze up front.  Flavors of bourbon and brandy with some roasted goodness.  Leaves some good lacing in numerous layers throughout the glass.  This is a great beer.

Wow.  Are you kidding me?  This is a great beer.  Pours black with dark head.  Aroma of coffee, bourbon, alcohol, and soy sauce.  Taste is dark fruit, roasted coffee, and booze.  Creamy and full-bodied.  Ill take another.
Pours pitch black, almost no head, just a dark tan head around the rim. Rich deep nose, coffe, malt, alcohol. Deep dark taste, warming, thick on the tongue with a long pleasant finish. Yumm!!!

Big hit of bourbon on the nose; raisins, apples, oak. Very boozy. Pours a deep black, with a thin, quickly vanishing head. Very complex flavour, sweet, with a hint of chocolate underneath. Quite syrupy mouth feel.

Pours without a head so no lace. Pitch black color, no highlights. Very light carbonation and medium-heavy bodied. Molasses and bourbon nose, flavor is almost burnt, sweet molasses and alcohol. Some alcohol burn. Seriously expensive at $17.99 for a caged & corked 375ml bottle from Julios Liquors Westborough, MA.

A - Dark black with a finger of frothy khaki-brown head. Fades quickly.

S - Sweet caramel and chocolate malts, vanilla, oak, Bourbon, brandy, caramelized malts, brown sugar, molasses, black licorice, booze.

T - Sweet caramel and chocolate malts, vanilla, oak, Bourbon, brandy, caramelized malts, molasses, black licorice, coffee, brown sugar, and some booze.

M - Full bodied with mild carbonation. Smooth with a sweet and warming finish.

D - Great balance barrel aged strong ale. Nice blend of beers.

Drank in tulip poured from 12.7oz bottle. Aroma- great bourbon smells like barrel aged. Appearance - silky black with no lacing. Taste - sweet but strong bourbon flavors. Very drinkable but strong and alcohol heat. Palate - alchohol and licorice. Overall- very pleased. Havent heard it was a BA but tastes likke one. Very very good.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2013 Approach with caution! Nose is assaulted with an enormous amounts of smells: honey, chocolate, coffee, whisky, dried fruits, caramel, brunt sugar, raisins... Just fantastic. Taking a sip makes you appreciate this even more. Chocolate, coffee, roasted walnuts, honey, some cloves, caramel, muscovado sugar and some hints of liqourice all vying for attention. Incredibly smooth with a long, slightly boozy aftertaste, this is pure bliss!

On tap at Fire on the Mountain.  Black with a light brown head.  Roasted malty chocolate aroma and flavor, light vanilla and wood.  Full body with a creamy soft feel, hides the alcohol well.  Light bitter hops, still fairly sweet, the perfect dessert beer.  Fucking fantastic.

Pours dark brown with a light brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, bourbon, vanilla, oak, chocolate, coffee, alcohol and light liquorish. Flavour is roasted malt, alcohol, bourbon, dried fruit, chocolate, vanilla and light oak.
Poured from bomber at dark lord day. Carmel taste with thick palate. Smooth and easy drinking. But my palate might be broken by now. This is really good tho

Bottle thanks to danielcurtis81. Bottle pours a dark brown to black with little to no head. Aroma of sweet bourbon and malts. Tastes sweet with an alcohol burn on the back end. I guess this could use some more time but I was excited to open it.

Bottle. Pours a very dark, opaque brown with minimal tan head. Essentially no retention or lacing, as expected of a beer of this strentgh. Aroma is chocolate, heavily roasted malt, tobacco, bourbon, brandy, smells intense. Flavor is bourbon, oak, brandy up front with a mildly roasted, dark malt, and dark chocolate finish. Alcohol is well masked despite the obvious spirit flavors, quite approachable considering the abv. Oaky, vanilla aftertaste that lingers. Soft carbonation, medium to full body, and a smooth texture. A very intense, enjoyable, complex, strong beer.

Draft at Monks Cafe in Philly. Opaque brown pour with a silky body and a tight foamy brown head that left swaths of lace around the glass. Like a fancy box of rich bourbon centered chocolates. Delicious! High ABV is well hidden - it adds to the richness but does not detract from its smoothness or drinkability. You do not have to be some highfalutin connoisseur to love this! One of the best stouts out there in general and to me 2nd maybe only to the Bourbon Barrel Angels Share (also from Lost Abbey.) Tremendous! Well worth one of the highest ratings I have ever given.
Bottle: pours dark black with no head, boozy aroma, taste is dark fruit, coffee, boozy, a little flat tasting as well due to the lack of carbonation.  Strong stuff.
nice strong ale

Delicious! The bourbon barreled The Serpents Stout and brandy barreled The Angels Share play very well together. Huge flavor malt, chocolate, toffee, and fine alcohol flavor all add up to a great beer.

Dark and delicious. No head tiny bubbles and legs on this give evidence to the strength in this viscous brew. Chocolate and oak and dark berries. This sucker is complex.

2013 Bottle.  Lots of booze on this one, in a good way.  Not really versed in brandy, but i believe that was the dominamt aroma and flavor, but tasted some bourbon inside.  Nice and complex.  Fantastic to sip on.

Poured a midnight black, almost no head formed. Smells like hot chocolate mixed with brandy followed by whiskey. Are we sure this is an American strong ale? Notes of chocolate, roasted malts and a heavy similarity to an imperial russian stout. Brandy is the most dominating feature of this which is a shame since I hate brandy. vanilla, raisins and some cherries. Not very much carbonation.

Bottle of the 2011. Deep brown with a nice beige head. Aroma is chocolate, liquorice, vanilla, oak, dates, molasses, booze. Thick and oily mouthfeel, sweet on the palate with a slightly boozy finish. Taste is chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, liquorice, dates, hint of soy sauce.

Pours a dark brown. The nose is bourbon, wet wood, warm spices fruit cake and vanilla. The pallet is bourbon, spices, sweet maltiness, raisin and finishes with vanilla and wood. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours almost entirely opaque black with a little bit of a muddy brown head. Lots of bourbon on the nose, vanilla, oak, cacao nibs, a little toasted malt. Taste has plenty of the vanilla, oak and bourbon notes from the smell as well as chocolate, toffee, toasted malt, some dark fruit and raisins, slightly hoppy finish. Very smooth, medium to full bodied with minimal carbonation. Amazingly balanced and complex beer.

Lost Abbey Deliverance 9/27/12 notes: bottle, summer 2012 vintage. Pour is cloudy dark brown, small head, just a ring of beige lacing. Lots of vanilla, bourbon, nougat on nose. Flavor is hot, with beautiful bourbon, oak, vanilla bean, and sweet cream. Strong stuff, warming on back end. A decadent beer best served on a chilly evening, possibly accompanied by cigar and conversation. All in all this is world class dessert beer, but I still prefer BB Serpent Stout over the blend.

Jet black, zero head, glassy such that you can use the surface like a mirror. Aroma is hard to explain; bourbon and brandy barrel aging is certainly present. A cherry-chocolate quality. That quality carries over to the flavor with the rich sweetness of bourbon and the dry fruitiness of brandy battling for supremacy, all while serpents stout occasionally pokes its head up. That is to say there are some dark roast, coffee tones. Others have noted booziness but i think it is restrained considering the 12.5 ABV. As for mouthfeel, dryness wins out in the end, light lingering bitterness. Intense but enjoyable brew.
Helt underbar. Fatlagring när det är som bäst. Absolut världsklass och ren njutning
on tap at Capitol beer & tap. pours black with a small tan head. good lacing, aroma of roasted malt,  molasses, raisins, excellent! great barley wine.

Poured from a 375 ml bottle. Pours a darker brown with absolutely no head. Looks flat. Aroma has plenty of wood and Bourbon and brandy notes.  Musty. Tastes kind of like a glass of booze thats been set out for awhile. Still hot on the back of the throat. Boozy.

On tap at Capitol Beer and Taproom, creamy mocha head, faint bourbon flavor, boozy mouthfeel.

Bottle.  Pours near pitch black with a small brown head that fades normally.  No lacing.  Big boozy aroma.  Bourbon and alcohol dominate the aroma but there are hints of licorice, coconut, and dark fruits.  Over-the-top boozy taste as well but much more of the barrel comes out.  Bourbon, alcohol, coconut, vanilla, dark fruit, cocoa, and lightly burnt wood.  Thick, chewy mouthfeel.  Long finish with hot alcohol and booze.  Overall, this beer is just not my thing.  Fairly complex but the huge booziness and hot alcohol really turn me off.  Really hard to finish my glass of it.

On tap @ Taste of Tops. Lovely boozy vanilla like aroma. Flavor is booze forward, but neither the bourbon or the brandy are over powering. Very nicely blended, with a very faint stout backbone.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @Linköping Beer Expo 2013. Aroma of alcohol, vanilla, coconut and cognac/brandy. Viscous mouthfeel. Tastes fick and full of alcoholol, dark fruits, cognac, some liquorice notes. Taste is constantly changing. Finish is relatively short, some liquorice notes. Stunning beer when ingested in small samples.
Great beer from Lost Abbey. Pours dark brown in colour with beige head. Malty with a bit alcohol. Full bodied, thick mouthfeel. Was a bit strange the first sip, but went on to beeing truly great.
Black pour, tan head. Nose is cocoa, dark fruits, some barrel. Taste is dark chocolate and dark fruits, some oak. Really smooth.

12.7 ounce corked and crowned bottle. Opaque black color with a small tan head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is strong oak with notes of bourbon, dark chocolate and dark fruits. Rich bittersweet roasted malt flavor with notes of smokiness, sweet Cuban coffee and bittersweet cocoa.  The finish is long, oaky and richly satisfying.

Almost bourbon aroma and black appearance with a balanced sweet trashed and warming mouthfeel.
